title: Social Skills Trainer
banerDescription: Become an expert in building relationships and effective communication in any organization.

description2: The aim of the studies is to comprehensively prepare specialists to work in shaping and developing social skills. The program emphasizes understanding social theories, a practical approach to teaching interpersonal skills, and developing training competencies. Students will gain knowledge in psychology, pedagogy, sociology, and coaching training techniques, which will allow them to effectively support the development of social competencies in various age groups and environments.
description3: The study program is divided into two semesters, including lectures, practical workshops, seminars, and professional internships. There is a possibility to complete 30 hours in a remote format at the MAGNOLIA Psychological and Pedagogical Counseling Center.

modules.title: Fundamentals of Psychology and Social Pedagogy

subtopics.title: Methods of teaching and developing social skills
Factors influencing the development of social skills
Consequences of lack of social skills
Recognition and differentiation of social disorders
Role of emotions in social life
Role of the trainer in personal development
Planning and evaluation of training sessions
Techniques for building and managing teams
Internship in educational and therapeutic institutions
Working with groups and individual clients under supervision
Summary and planning of further professional development

faculty: The program will be conducted by experienced specialists in psychology, pedagogy, sociology, and professional social skills trainers with many years of clinical and training experience. The faculty consists of experts with practical experience in training and coaching work, which will ensure a high level of education and support for students.
practices:
• 50% - possibility to complete internships remotely at the MAGNOLIA Psychological and Pedagogical Counseling Center
  • The remaining 50% can be completed:
    • in home institutions in the form of additional classes or performed within the teaching load,
    • in educational institutions,
    • in counseling centers,
    • other.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes will be based on: preparation of a project work in the area of Social Skills Training.
jobOpportunities: Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:-Social skills trainers in educational, therapeutic, and business institutions-Consultants in training companies-Personal and professional development specialists-Employees in non-governmental organizations dealing with education and social support-Coaches and mentors-Mediators and conflict management specialists-Team leaders in various industries
